description: Job TypeFull-time Description SummaryThe Business Development Manager is responsible for creating business development strategies which align to the core studio's market growth and business plans. This role will be responsible to expand market share, drive revenue and profitability, and positively engage potential clients which further engrains JLG Architects into the communities we serve. Why JLG? Because we work together to empower the future of architecture and design, driving dynamic solutions that make lives better. We are employee owners, collectively invested in the success of our clients, communities, and each other. Our candidates bring a diverse background of talent, a spirit of collaboration, and an enduring desire to help others thrive. At JLG, you will find inspiration to ignite change, challenge the status quo, and build resilient foundations for the next generation of industry, education, healthcare, sports, and civic service. Sport Studio Expertise We've assembled a dream team of world-class visionaries that will take the lead with a collaborative design process, driven by the industry's most advanced building and design technologies. When it's time to define your vision for an athletic and entertainment destination - JLG's Sports studio will be warmed up and ready to get in the game. The expectations of athletes and fans have never been greater. Adaptable architecture and cruise worthy concourses aren't enough to win the day. Backstage, athletes, coaches, and entertainers want first-class pampering with premium lounges, training rooms, hydration and nutrition stations, media centers, and other amenities that enhance their performance. JLG keeps our head in the game, setting the pace for next season and building a future-ready foundation that will level the recruitment field. Reports toPractice Studio Leader ResponsibilitiesWork with JLG's Practice Studio Leader to establish near-term (annual) and longer-term (3-5 year) geographic market relationship strategy/goals. Primary focus is to lead JLG business development strategy within a defined geographic area. Must clearly understand firm and studio BD strategy and this position's role to execute specific related tasks. Develop formal geographic-based strategy that aligns, supports, and enhances the practice studio business strategy. Support defined JLG studio growth strategies by leading city/regional engagement focused business development activities. Strategy will encompass the market's role in elevating JLG brand and support JLG's studio business development. Develop strategy to ensure support and engagement in JLG's local community. Identify and support strategically defined local business partners and relationships to connect with studio strategy and to best serve local client-base. Represent JLG in local community by being involved in its geography (e.g., participation in Chamber of Commerce, Economic Development, Planning Commission, etc.). Engage in regular communication cadence with studio leaders. All other duties as assigned. RequirementsA Bachelor's degree in Business, Architecture or a related field required Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated Business Development or Client Relationship experience Demonstrated experience with a track record of business and market growth Preferred Qualifications:5+ years of AEC industry experience Experience and expertise in contract management, negotiation, with a strong acumen to influence decision makers
